text: Margaret C. "Peg" Snyder (January 30, 1929 â€“ January 26, 2021) was an American social scientist. Her work focused on women and economic development, particularly in Africa. She was the founding director of the United Nations Development Fund for Women (UNIFEM), whose name was changed to UN Women in 2011. She was also a co-founder of Women's World Banking and of the African Training and Research Centre for Women. Snyder died on January 26, 2021 in New York City from cardiac arrest, aged 91. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from cardiac arrest Category:American sociologists Category:United Nations officials Category:Scientists from Syracuse, New York Category:Writers from Syracuse, New York
title: Margaret C. Snyder
